text: Benjamin Peter James Bradshaw (born 30 August 1960) is an English politician and the Member of Parliament for the Exeter constituency in the United Kingdom. He was elected in the 1997 general election. He was a BBC Radio reporter before entering politics. He was a Minister of State in the Department of Health, a Minister for the South West and Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport. He holds no posts in the current shadow government. He is a member of the Labour Party. ==References== Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Members of the British House of Commons for English constituencies Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs
title: Ben Bradshaw
